page.title: 05RURAL TRANSPORT
page.content:
The area surveyed has virtually no {public transport.
Long distance{buses}and{coaches}use the nearby A5 road but there are no services to the villages.
Most people have a{car.} Those that do not have to rely on{taxis}or{walking.
Where there are bus services, the elderly, those over 60, can often travel for only 10 pence. Local Authorities pay an annual subsidy to bus companies to cover the consessionary fares.
People are very concerned about plans to split up the{National Bus Company. Privatisation in this way will,it is feared, reduce rural services even more.
